issue.title: sp_member_access errors all over: use boost::make_shared instead

content.raw: I've been attempting to get a simple reproduction scenario for this without luck. It never fails when loading a single plugin. My primary application loads eight plugins; the failure is much more common there. It also is less likely to fail the longer gzserver has been running. Waiting five seconds after gzserver starts running before I load my model file seems to eliminate the failure. Is there some signal I should be watching to know that gzserver is fully initialized?
content.html: I've been attempting to get a simple reproduction scenario for this without luck. It never fails when loading a single plugin. My primary application loads eight plugins; the failure is much more common there. It also is less likely to fail the longer gzserver has been running. Waiting five seconds after gzserver starts running before I load my model file seems to eliminate the failure. Is there some signal I should be watching to know that gzserver is fully initialized?
